DataElement.preferredName: Performance Status Two Week Prior Enrollment Greater Than or Equal To Integer::50 Assessment Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator response regarding whether a patient's performance status score is greater than or equal to 50 within 2 weeks prior to enrollment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Performance Status Two Week Prior Enrollment Greater Than or Equal To Integer::50 Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities._A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one._Any period of seven consecutive days._Earlier in time or order._The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::50_The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

Concepts.definition: A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

Property.preferredName: Two Week Prior Enrollment Greater Than or Equal To Integer::50 Assessment
Property.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.:Any period of seven consecutive days.:Earlier in time or order.:The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::50:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.
Any period of seven consecutive days.
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
